009
010package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
011
012import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
013
014import imagingbook.common.color.adapt.BradfordAdaptation;
015import imagingbook.common.color.adapt.ChromaticAdaptation;
016import imagingbook.common.color.cie.StandardIlluminant;
017
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * This class implements the CIELuv color space. See Sec. 14.2 of [1] for
022 * additional details. All component values are assumed to be in [0,1].
023 * Conversion from/to sRGB is implemented directly through D65-based XYZ
024 * coordinates, i.e., without conversion to Java's D50-based profile connection
025 * space. The methods fromCIEXYZ/toCIEXYZ still return D50-based XYZ coordinates
026 * in Java's profile connection space. This is a singleton class with no public
027 * constructors, use {@link #getInstance()} to obtain the single instance.
028 * </p>
029 * <p>
030 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
031 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
032 * </p>
033 * 
034 * @author WB
035 * @version 2022/09/01
036 */
037@SuppressWarnings("serial")
038public class LuvColorSpace extends ColorSpace implements DirectD65Conversion {
039        private static final sRgbColorSpace srgbCS = sRgbColorSpace.getInstance();
040        private static final LuvColorSpace instance = new LuvColorSpace();
041        
042        public static LuvColorSpace getInstance() {
043                return instance;
044        }
045                
046        // D65 reference white point:
047        private static final double[] XYZref = StandardIlluminant.D65.getXYZ();
048        private static final double uuref = fu(XYZref[0], XYZref[1], XYZref[2]); // u'_n
049        private static final double vvref = fv(XYZref[0], XYZref[1], XYZref[2]); // v'_n
050        
051        // chromatic adaptation objects:
052        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD65toD50 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(StandardIlluminant.D65, StandardIlluminant.D50);
053        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toD65 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(StandardIlluminant.D50, StandardIlluminant.D65);
054        
055        /** Constructor (non-public). */
056        private LuvColorSpace() {
057                super(TYPE_Luv,3);
058        }
059        
060        // XYZ50->CIELuv: returns Luv values from XYZ (relative to D50)
061        @Override
062        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] XYZ50) {      
063                float[] XYZ65 = catD50toD65.applyTo(XYZ50);
064                return this.fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
065        }
066        
067        // XYZ65->CIELuv: returns Luv values from XYZ (relative to D65)
068        @Override
069        public float[] fromCIEXYZ65(float[] XYZ65) {    
070                double X = XYZ65[0];
071                double Y = XYZ65[1];    
072                double Z = XYZ65[2];
073                double YY = f1(Y / XYZref[1]);          // Y'
074                double uu = fu(X,Y,Z);          // u'
075                double vv = fv(X,Y,Z);          // v'
076                double L = (116.0 * YY - 16.0);                 //L*
077                double u = (13 * L * (uu - uuref));     //u*
078                double v = (13 * L * (vv - vvref));     //v*
079                return new float[] {(float)L, (float)u, (float)v};
080        }
081        
082        // CIELab->XYZ50: returns XYZ values (relative to D50) from Luv
083        @Override
084        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] Luv) {
085                float[] XYZ65 = this.toCIEXYZ65(Luv);
086                return catD65toD50.applyTo(XYZ65);
087        }
088        
089        // CIELab->XYZ65
090        @Override
091        public float[] toCIEXYZ65(float[] Luv) {
092                double L = Luv[0];
093                double u = Luv[1];
094                double v = Luv[2];
095                double Y = XYZref[1] * f2((L + 16) / 116.0);
096                double uu = (L < 0.00001) ? uuref : u / (13 * L) + uuref; // u'
097                double vv = (L < 0.00001) ? vvref : v / (13 * L) + vvref; // v'
098                double X = Y * ((9*uu)/(4*vv));
099                double Z = Y * ((12 - 3 * uu - 20 * vv) / (4 * vv));
100                return new float[] {(float)X, (float)Y, (float)Z};
101        }
102        
103        //sRGB -> CIELuv
104        @Override
105        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
106                float[] XYZ65 = srgbCS.toCIEXYZ65(srgb);
107                return this.fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
108        }
109        
110        //CIELuv -> sRGB
111        @Override
112        public float[] toRGB(float[] Luv) {
113                float[] XYZ65 = this.toCIEXYZ65(Luv);
114                float[] srgb = srgbCS.fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
115                return srgb;
116        }
117        
118        //---------------------------------------------------------------------
119        
120        private static final double Epsilon = 216.0/24389;
121        private static final double Kappa = 841.0/108;
122        
123        // Gamma correction for L* (forward)
124        private double f1 (double c) {
125                return (c > Epsilon) ? Math.cbrt(c) : (Kappa * c) + (16.0 / 116);
126        }
127        
128        // Gamma correction for L* (inverse)
129        private double f2 (double c) {
130                final double c3 = c * c * c; //Math.pow(c, 3.0);
131                return (c3 > Epsilon) ? c3 : (c - 16.0 / 116) / Kappa;
132        }
133        
134        private static double fu (double X, double Y, double Z) { // X,Y,Z must be positive
135                // fails if 0.001 is used!
136                return (X < 0.00001) ? 0 : (4 * X) / (X + 15 * Y + 3 * Z);
137        }
138        
139        private static double fv (double X, double Y, double Z) { // X,Y,Z must be positive
140                return (Y < 0.00001) ? 0 : (9 * Y) / (X + 15 * Y + 3 * Z);
141        }
142
143}
